overview:
Zbigniew is a veteran of the IT and Telecommunication industries. He got his first job as a teenager, writing security patches and modules for Linux kernel 2.0.x over 10 years ago. Since then, he looked for (and found) challenges in various fields - from creating custom billing and business support systems for leading Polish telcos, through performing computer security audits and penetration testing for high-profile companies and government institutions, all the way to designing and implementing microcontroller devices.

For the last few years, he has been mainly focusing on companies and projects in their early stages. In 2004, Zbigniew became the first employee and CTO of a VoIP startup, in which he single-handedly designed the voice network, implemented his own billing and accompanying systems, and also hired and trained a small IT team.

In 2007 he co-founded the leading Polish (and supposedly the largest European) microblogging platform, Blip.pl, and sold it to Gadu-Gadu S.A. (a subsidiary of Naspers, a NASDAQ-traded company).

Father of a 5-year-old geek in training.

relationships.title: Founder and Member of the Board
